hints_html:
The average value of a function on the interval \(\displaystyle [a,b]\) is

\(f_{av} = \frac1{b-a} \int_a^b f(x)\,dx.\)
hints_latex:
The average value of a function on the interval $\displaystyle [a,b]$ is

$f_{av} = \frac1{b-a} \int_a^b f(x)\,dx.$
hints_raw:
The average value of a function on the interval <math>\displaystyle [a,b]</math> is

<math> f_{av} = \frac1{b-a} \int_a^b f(x)\,dx.</math>
question: 1 (b)
sols_html:
Here \(a=0\), \(b=\pi\) and \(f(x) = \sin x.\) Thus

\[\begin{aligned} f_{av} &= \frac1{\pi-0} \int_0^\pi \sin x\,dx \\ &= \frac1{\pi} \left.(-\cos x)\right|_0^\pi \\ &= \frac1{\pi} (-\cos \pi + \cos 0) \\ &= \frac2{\pi}.\end{aligned}\]
